tn.ref: Like a vapor of mist, like a breeze in the wind
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: What profit does mankind gain ... under the sun?
tn.text: "Mankind gains no profit ... under the sun." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: The writer is presenting the natural order of life as he understands it.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Writer continues with natural order observations.

tn.ref: Everything becomes wearisome
tn.text: Since man is unable to explain these things, it becomes futile to try. AT: "everything becomes tiring"

tn.ref: The eye is not satisfied by what it sees
tn.text: One can not simply deduce to a simple explanation what one sees. AT: "A person is not satisfied by what his eyes see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: nor is the ear fulfilled by what it hears
tn.text: One can not simply deduce to a simple explanation what one hears. AT: "nor is a person content by what his ears hear"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: There is nothing new regarding man and his activities.

tn.ref: whatever has been done is what will be done
tn.text: AT: "whatever people have done is what people will do in the future" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Is there anything about which it may be said, 'Look, this is new'?
tn.text: AT: "There is nothing about which someone may say, 'Look, this is new.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: will not likely be remembered either
tn.text: AT: "people will not likely remember them either"

tn.ref: I applied my mind
tn.text: AT: "I determined" or "I made up my mind"

tn.ref: to study and to search out
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize diligently he studied. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: children of mankind
tn.text: AT: "human beings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: all the deeds that are done
tn.text: AT: "everything that people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: vapor
tn.text: "mist" or "breath." It does not last. AT: "temporary" or "worthless." What people do is like vapor because it does not last and is worthless. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: The Teacher says that the things that people do are like trying to catch the wind or to keep the wind from blowing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: The twisted cannot be straightened! The missing cannot be counted!
tn.text: AT: "People cannot straighten things that are twisted! They cannot count what is not there!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I applied my heart
tn.text: AT: "I determined" or "I made up my mind"

tn.ref: madness and folly
tn.text: The words "madness" and "folly" share similar meanings and refer to foolish thinking and behavior, respectively. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: an attempt to shepherd the wind
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:12|1:14]].
